department: Travaux publics et Services gouvernementaux Canada
description: Installation, supply and maintenance of Cable or Satellite services to multiple locations within Garrison Wainwright, Denwood, in Alberta.
tags: End User: Department of National Defence
full_summary:
# Tender Announcement: Cable or Satellite Services ## Solicitation Information * **Solicitation Number:** W168A-21MK04/B * **Reference Number:** PW-CAL-143-7279 * **Amendment Number:** 6 * **Publication Date:** October 19, 2022 * **Tender Closing Date:** January 6, 2023 at 2:00 PM MST * **Expected Contract Start Date:** N/A * **Expected Contract End Date:** N/A * **Tender Status:** Expired ## Solicitation Details * **Request for Proposal:** Yes * **Notice Type:** Competitive - Open bidding * **Procurement Category:** Service * **Trade Agreements:** CFTA, Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement, Canada-Peru Free Trade Agreement, Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement, Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement * **Comprehensive Land Claim Agreement:** No ## Requirement Description The Department of National Defence (DND) requires a contract for the installation, supply, and maintenance of Cable or Satellite Television services to multiple locations within Garrison Wainwright, Denwood, Alberta. All deliverables must be received, installed, and fully operational with cable/satellite services by January 31, 2023. ## Evaluation and Selection Criteria A bid must comply with the requirements of the bid solicitation and meet all mandatory technical evaluation criteria to be declared responsive. The responsive bid with the lowest evaluated price will be recommended for award of a contract. ## Contact Information * **Contact Name:** Roxanne Kunz * **Contact Email:** roxanne.kunz@pwgsc-tpsgc.gc.ca * **Contact Phone:** (403) 463-0037 * **Contact Fax:** (418) 566-6167 * **Address:** Harry Hays Building (HHB)
Room 759, 220-4th Avenue SE, Calgary, Alberta, T2G 4X3 ## Site Visit A site visit is recommended but not mandatory. Bidders are invited to attend a site visit at Building 593 on November 8, 2022, starting at 8:30 AM MST. ## Important Notice Due to the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic, temporary measures are being taken to encourage social distancing at the Western Region Bid Receiving Unit. Suppliers are strongly encouraged to submit bids electronically using the Canada Post Corporation's (CPC) Connect
